word:
No sooner had their eyes become accustomed to the glorious presence of the one angel, than, lo! the whole plain was lighted up with the wondrous glory of the multitude of angels that peopled the plains of Bethlehem. The angel quieted the fears of the shepherds before opening their eyes to behold the multitude of the heavenly
160
host, all praising God, and saying, “Glory to God in the highest; and on earth, peace, good will to men.”—RH Dec. 9, 1884.
